ygData.subject: Dumb People
ygData.msgSnippet: Alright the mage thinks to themselves, I need a nice safe place to meditate. Hm, this bridge here should be safe.  When folks train the really tough monsters
ygData.messageBody:
Alright the mage thinks to themselves, I need a nice safe place to meditate.
Hm, this bridge here should be safe. When folks train the really tough
monsters like that big Proon, they'll most certainly bring him this way.
Yes, I'll sit down right here, because I can be most certain this is where
Proon will be standing angrily when the fleeing person is gone. And I will
have no time to even stand up before I'm dead! Perfect! Oh that rivershore
nearby is far too safe, Proon might not see me, completely unacceptable.

I cannot believe the angry shouts from these people, angry they were not
warned Proon was coming. Dumb people.

Today was the first day I actually quit a group and actually informed them
it was because they were such a bad group. Usually I am more discreet,
because the bad players actually try to be good players, and may learn one
day. But this group, from their idiotic banter, to their actions, arrgh!
They got me killed by all four, not just one, the whole dullard lot of them
chasing after a hurt monster, happily slashing away. Meanwhile the bard is
left to fend for himself! Not only that, I was stacking Hymn and Anthem...
with another bard in the group, playing... of all things, Accelerando!
During battle! He told me he was playing it because we might have to flee.
For the whole battle, he plays it, for when we flee..... <<rolls eyes>>

I think bards may have a bad reputation by the dumb people who like just one
song, likely the entire basis of their class-choice, and play this song even
at the innapropriate times! This fool-bard also mentioned he was twinked so
heavily because he sold crack. "Only the gods can help me now!" I thought,
and they didn't.

Roop
